intro: Duggena panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian duggena, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland areas and thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Duggena panamensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
